name: Mille Murs de Glace.
Expendable Pawns v1.0
description:
After seeing Restoring Face, I knew I had to build a deck around the Elizabeth Mills - Restoring Face combo. The idea of sacrificing an Executive, giving her all the blame about an environmental crysis or whatsoever, just to save face, was too good to pass upon. Oh and hey, if push comes to shove, you can always sacrifice Mr. Howard for the well-being of the company!

Besides, not caring much about the Bad Publicity with Weyland Consortium also means you'll have plenty of cash, and allows you to use a lot of shady ICE. I mean... Fenris, Grim and Swarm are totally legit - cross my heart.

Anyway, BIG ICE, a lot of economy, Interns to eventually put Curtain Wall back at the outermost level, or just to recycle an Elizabeth Mills, maybe. When the public outrage subsides, the lady could be reinstated to an executive position as if nothing ever happened! I'd hate to waste her talent.

name: Fast Advance - Jack of all trades
description:
Straightforward Fast Advance. Force the runner to pay a lot of credits per run.

When Fear and Loathing comes, Corporate War should change into Market Research. Likewise paper wall should change to Wraparound

name: First Place Castelldefells Store Championship
description:
AKA "Kit goes where she pleases! v1.1"

This is an "hybrid" Rielle deck: it uses her ability to get in in the early game, but then builds a standard shaper full rig for the late game.

Of course there are a few shenanigans, namely Scavenges to "remap" Cyber-Cyphers and Femme Fatales as needed, Escher to reposition the bad ICEs and a Chakana, tutorable with the SMCs and to be used as a temporary patch against Fast Advance decks.

name: Freek Clicks - v1.0
The Beginning and the End
description:
This is my personal shot at trying to utilise the two new breakers from Fear and Loathing, Alpha and Omega. Based only on theorycrafting up to now, I see huge potential in forcing the corp to go at least 3 Ice deep on centrals AND remotes to keep me out. Keyhole was added because it puts pressure on R&D as well as archives and force the corp to ice both up. As a nice side effect I can ruin the corps game plan by trashing key cards like SanSan, scorched or just the good old Hedge Fund.

Once the Corp does go 3 deep, I have my ways to deal with it either through a Femme counter, a Knight or Atman. In case I end up with 4 deep (which can happen), a combination of those should still get me in. I can also Test Run a Femme for a surprise "inside job" on a remote. Knight fulfills a double purpose in this Deck, I need him to apply early pressure and also crack the middle Ice once Alpha and Omega are on the field. Of course, all of this will eat a whole lot of MU (especially with Magnum), so this is where the Cyber Solutions Chip comes in. Akamatsu is not going to cut it, especially with Keyhole and Magnum both eating up 2 MU each. I included Stimhack mainly because I had a slot and one Influence left over, but it also synergizes nicely with the deck in allowing me to make a surprise run when the corp thought I was out of credits.

name: Jinteki Fast ad
Fast Scorched Earth
Rapid Professor Deck
Return of the Noise
description: 1st place @ Crossroad Games Standish, ME - Store Championship

name: Boring Old HB FA
description: 1st place @ Crossroad Games Standish, ME - Store Championship

name: Noobie's First Try
description: I've only been playing Netrunner for just under a month. This is my first attempt at a 100% self-made deck (no copying, editing, or anything of the sort). Any suggestions on deck construction would be wonderful, as would any tips on playing the deck.

name: Kate Professional Anarch
description:
This is a deck that I'm currently playing (or have played) in my local meta, as well as on my stream: http://www.twitch.tv/flowerpot_wang

It was originally inspired by this article on stimhack: http://stimhack.com/kate-professional-anarch/ - the idea that viruses are mega-cheap for kate is something that really stuck with me.

Please feel free to contact me @flowerpotwang :)

name: HB Ares v2
description:
A deck that's evolved through the months, it's all about advancing agendas 'the hard way', protecting them with Ash, Ruhr Valley, Red Herrings etc. Sometimes over-advancing Project agendas to devastating effect.

Also Simone Diego with Thomas Haas is great fun.

I sometimes play it on my stream http://www.twitch.tv/flowerpot_wang as well as in my local meta, please feel free to contact me @flowerpotwang.

name: Lightning Trap
description: Yes, there is a lot of cards yet to be revealed, but I'm already thinking about how awesome low point agendas in a no advance jinteki deck can be. Create a lot of remote servers...don't be afraid to create ones with shock, snares, fetals and such.The only agenda that you WANT to score ASAP is House of Knives. Philotic Entanglement is a killer during mid game. Inazuma + Komainu is AWESOME and can kill the runner if you have a HoK scored. Any brain damaged landed and the runner is in deep trouble here.

name: Myriad Games 1st Place Plugged-In
description: 1st Place @ Plugged In 2013 Myriad Games

name: Crossroads Games 1st Place Store Championship
description: 1st place @ Crossroad Games Standish, ME - Store Championship

name: Exile V.1.0
Gabriel Santiago: Exposing the truth
description: I wanted to play around with Blackguard and threw in a little bad pub punishment to boot.

name: Fürnflo
Noise Deck
description: Just starting out. Any help is appreciated!

name: Justeki Bonzai Cactus
description: It's such a prickly deck. Ambushes galore, bluffs, and low-point agendas.

name: Noise Deck
description: Just starting out. Any help is appreciated!

name: Kit Yogosaurus
description:
under construzction for store championship

suggestions welcome :)

name: Reina Virus
NBN Tag Stacking 1.10
description:
This is the current version of my NBN deck. It works well as a FA deck or as a tag storm, midseason/psychographics deck.

Private Security Force and Scorched Earth provide the threat of meat damage which will slow down the runner a bit and also provide an alternate win conditions.

The deck runs pretty well and has a decent win rate. Thinking about replacing PSF with market research. Will have to test both and compare...

name: How Many Clicks Do You Have? 1.0
description:
Inspired by Write to the Brain v2.1

I thought I would have more trouble rezzing all the big ice here but the economy has yet to fail me. Reina Roja ends up being my toughest matchup, I was thinking of subbing the Successful Demonstrations for Oversight AIs.

Minelayer is great in your opening hand, very "ehhhh" in any other draw.

name: Andromeda
Mr. Santiago: Exposed! 1.0
description: Trying to build a BlackGuard Deck. Daunting task so far.

name: Rush Cerebral Imaging - Lightning Advance
description:
The ice is taken straight from Running Bear's HB:ETF fast advance. It is the perfect setup for solid early ETRs and then destroyers to buy a bit of time once they get breakers. If you have more then one available, the power shutdowns can also try to snipe cheap breakers. And don't worry about the bad pub. You'll win/lose before it matters.

The plan: Score Efficiency Committee the hard way. Draw into Shipment from SS and use it to score another Efficiency Committee or a Vitruvirus with one counter from hand. Draw/vitruvirus into JH, Priority Req, Power Shutdown and Accelerated while ditching other 2 Shipments if drawn. Once ready, spend last Efficiency counter to install Priority, install JH and then do the Power Shutdown combo with 3 shipments, winning.

I'm still working on perfecting it, but the premise seems solid in light testing. Might consider dropping something for an extra Accelerated Diagnostics (enhance reliability), adding anonymous tips for even more draw power and trying the other HB identities (Next or ETF could be interesting for rush/money respectively). The version I'm currently using swaps the Blue Level Clearances for Successful Demonstrations, but I intend to switch as soon as I can track down Fear and Loathing.

Credits: Running Bear for the ice setup. Sebastian Barth had a fantastic article on match points and a great NEXT Rush deck that both inspired this

name: Plan A: FA (v1.1)
description:
New Honor and Profit spoilers means an update to Harmony Medtech fast advance!

Agenda mix: Philotic Entanglement is there because it's another 3/2 that can be scored out of hand with Mushin No Shin plus either Plan B or Trick of Light. Another option is to cut Nisei and run 1x The Future Perfect and 1x Clone Retirement.

Ice mix: Wraparound, Guard, Swordsman, and Chimera should force the Runner to install an actual breaker suite, which will hopefully delay them long enough for you to win the game.

Economy: Wraparound and Guard made me feel comfortable cutting Tollbooth and turning it into a true rush deck, so Restructure became too slow. Instead, I plan to play a lower econ game and brought in Shipment from SanSan.

If you don't fear expose effects, cut Zaibatsu for +1 Trick of Light and +1 Swordsman. No one runs expose in my local meta (other than me!), but I keep expecting it to start showing up.

name: Nasir - Don't Feed the Wyrms!
description:
Wyrm + Parasite Recursion

Host your replicated hardware on the personal workshop and use any left over credits to pay them down. Eat almost every piece of Ice you encounter. Use the Replicator to get 3x The Personal Touch (on Wyrm), a few Cyberfeeders, and a Self-modifying code (for a Parasite of course) and then you are finally ready to run.

Admittedly, This rig will be a little slow to get up and running, but (in theory), it can really start to slice through newly rezzed Ice.

name: Money Wall
description:
My first Weyland deck that tested out a couple strategies. How effective is operations+agenda economy (no asset economy)? Also, is Off the Grid viable? My playtest results show these strategies work very well.

Objective is to load up on $ through operations and agendas. You heavily fortify HQ to protect the off the grid remote server (you only need 1). You defend R&D with ICE and also via precognition to make successful runs ineffective. When you think HQ is fairly safe you drop Curtain Wall on the far end (for the strength bonus) and then play Off the grid and start speed advancing agendas in the off the grid server.

Vet program is to mitigate the bad pub you get from hostile takeover and geothermal fracking (if you cash in the counters off it). Either of which can be sacrificed once they score to rez Archer, in addition to priority req which will pay the added cost for archer (or the fatty price of curtain wall).

Jackson howard is used for card drawing as needed but mostly for recycling key cards back into R&D like off the grid, precog, curtain wall, and if you clump a bunch of agendas in your hand.

name: ARM_MOTION v2.4
description:
New iteration of my deck that won Team Covenant's League Top 8 earlier this month.

Due to the need of expose cards, I have taken out my Rooks for 2 Infliltration. Rook is strong and I like it, but a lot of times I just don't want to play it and Reina's ability is good enough most of the time. I have been considering removing Djinn instead, but I tend to use Djinn when I hit it more often than Rook.

name: Noise Mill v2
description: Not yet playtested. Designed to avoid damage by avoiding accessing cards and winning with a mill strategy. Keyhole is great b/c I can choose what to mill, instead of milling blind. Mill the points so corp can't win, then ice, then powerful cards.

name: Reina runs all day every day
description: Trying out reina with wildside. I feel like this deck will start slow but be fearsome once the rig is up. Maybe add retrieval run to help get started quicker?

name: Japanese Journalism
description:
Make money, win traces and use RSVP and Sensei to make things very difficult for the runner. Those two ice can wreak havoc. Sensei makes Data Raven, Shadow, Pop Up and RSVP so much better. No barriers, no Jackson...but they don't need to know that...by mid to late game you will have won with Astro chain.

Have a try with it... it is performing very well at our local scene.

Update: The two PSFs are now Market Research. I've played enough tag-me runners now to think that I'm going to be able to Astro+Astro+Market for enough agenda pts for a win.

name: Andromeda flashes the cops for fun
description: Standard andromeda deck but includes the chance to mill the corp if john masonori, data leak reversal, and crash space get into play at the same time.

name: Keyhole Andi v2.0
description: This deck was made in response to a BGG post looking for advice. The goal is to get Keyhole out quickly and put pressure on centrals, until memory constraints force you into a traditional rig.

name: Das Durdlemeister 2/19/2014
description: Version 2, 2/19/2014 Simple version that I'm trying out. I started playing Netrunner 2 weeks ago after almost a decade of MtG and I don't know what I'm doing, halp.

name: My Personal Shell Game v1
description: Install, Advance, Advance. Do this this with traps / agendas till you get a Cerebral Overwriter. Once you land the brain damage, start triple installing, hoping to blow up some net damage.
